In this position, you'll work with two main consumer groups: internal decision-makers including product managers, product designers, and department heads, as well as external customers who rely on insights to support their decision-making based on historical and forecasted performance.

Location requirement: For optimal collaboration and real-time communication with our core team, we‚Äôre only considering candidates currently based within approximately ¬±3 hours of the Rotterdam time zone.

What You'll Do

Data Infrastructure & Pipeline Management


Build and maintain robust data pipelines, connecting all relevant data sources from sales, marketing, product, and finance
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting solutions
Continuously improve and optimize reporting processes and tools



Analysis & Insights


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and business objectives
Analyze data sources and identify key metrics and performance indicators
Conduct comprehensive data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic decision-making
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for various audiences



Reporting & Visualization


Design and develop comprehensive reporting solutions, including interactive dashboards, visualizations, and detailed reports
Create compelling data stories that effectively communicate findings to stakeholders

Continuous Learning

Identify opportunities to enhance our data capabilities and recommend new tools or methodologies



What We're Looking For

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with a focus on reporting and data analysis
Strong understanding of data analysis and reporting methodologies



Technical Skills


Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python)
Expert-level skills in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, QuickSight)
Proficiency in maintaining data pipelines using tools such as Airflow
Experience with AWS data-related tools is a plus
Experience with product metrics tooling like Amplitude is a plus



Soft Skills


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a cross-functional team
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and quality



Bonus Points


Experience with business travel platforms
Knowledge of the travel technology industry

Join our international team remotely and be part of a company that's revolutionizing business travel technology. You'll work in a collaborative environment where your insights will directly impact business strategy and client success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading organization in the Life Sciences industry, is looking for a Clinical Trial Data Analyst to strengthen their clinical operations team. This position plays a pivotal role in enhancing how clinical trials are designed, planned, and monitored, ensuring each study is strategically positioned for success using a data-driven approach. You will collaborate closely with study teams to turn complex datasets into actionable insights that guide location targeting, patient recruitment, and site performance.




Key Responsibilities:




Provide analytical expertise to support trial planning, with a strong focus on location strategy and patient population targeting.
Develop and maintain tools, models, and databases that facilitate the interpretation of large-scale data relevant to trial feasibility and operational performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally to translate data outputs into practical insights for clinical teams.
Conduct analyses using real-world data sources such as EHR and medical claims to support decision-making in study design and site selection.
Apply advanced modeling techniques, including probabilistic simulations, to evaluate potential trial outcomes.
Present findings clearly using high-impact visuals and summaries tailored to clinical and non-technical audiences.
Leverage internal and external clinical data platforms to support performance analytics and study optimization.




Required Qualifications:




Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field (equivalent practical experience also considered).
Minimum of 5 years' experience in clinical trial analytics or operations, ideally within a pharmaceutical or CRO environment.
Proven track record in feasibility studies, site selection analytics, and performance monitoring in clinical trials.
Strong knowledge of clinical research processes and regulatory frameworks.
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation, aggregation, and analysis.
Advanced skills in Excel for modeling and data visualization; confident presenter with PowerPoint.
Familiarity with real-world healthcare data (EHR, claims) and clinical trial databases such as Citeline is a plus.
Experience in using simulation techniques such as Monte Carlo to assess multivariable outcomes.

Description:
Description

Data Analyst

New York Public Radio, a premier public media organization, seeks a Data Analyst to help NYPR move from raw data to real understanding, helping shape content strategies, marketing decisions, and audience engagement efforts. This work ensures our teams have the right data, in the right format, at the right time, with tools that empower action.

The Data Analyst is a key member of NYPR‚Äôs Audience Team, bridging data engineering and analysis to power audience insights across the organization. This person will oversee the collection of data, prepare analysis-ready datasets, and create Tableau dashboards that inform decision-making across Programming, News, Membership, Development, Product, and Sponsorship teams.

You will have the opportunity to satisfy your curiosity by seeking connections between data created by live listening, on-demand downloads, engagement with websites and apps and revenue operations. As a result, you‚Äôll be deeply embedded in the day-to-day work of cross-functional teams, helping NYPR understand how listeners engage with our journalism, storytelling, and programming, and where we can create more value, loyalty, and joy.

This person will report to the Dir, Audio Product, Analytics & Architecture.

Responsibilities:


Create clean, analysis-ready datasets that support dashboards and reporting for stakeholder teams.
Build and maintain Tableau dashboards that track KPIs and enable self-service access to audience and content insights.
Define and monitor core metrics related to audience engagement, retention and content performance.
Explore audience behavior and translate findings into clear, actionable insights for internal partners.
Work collaboratively with partners across the Programming, News, Membership, Development, Audience, and Sponsorship teams to align data tools with strategic goals.
Document pipeline logic, metric definitions, and data models to promote data literacy and shared understanding.
Drive a culture of data-informed decision-making, balancing rigor, accessibility, and storytelling.


Qualifications:


Demonstrate experience in analytics, data engineering, or a hybrid analytics engineering role.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with AWS Redshift or other cloud-based data warehouses.
Comfortable with Python or another scripting language for automation and transformation tasks.
Built dashboards in Tableau (or a similar BI tool) and know how to design them for impact and usability.
Experience working with AWS services like Redshift, Lambda, S3, and managing data pipelines using custom scripts and scheduled queries.
Strong communicator who can translate complex data into clear insights for technical and non-technical audiences alike.
Curious about audience behavior and excited to help a mission-driven media organization grow its reach and deepen its relationship with listeners.
Bonus: experience working in media, journalism, or a nonprofit/membership-driven organization.


We know there are great candidates who may not fit into what we‚Äôve described above or who have important skills we haven‚Äôt thought of. If that‚Äôs you, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.

This is a full-time role with a salary range of $100,000 - 110,000, annually (plus a full benefits package). Salary offered within this range is determined by skills, experience and organizational pay equity. New York Public Radio also offers comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, along with vacation time, personal days, sick time and parental leave.

This role is based in New York City (or the immediate metro area) and operates in a hybrid capacity. This individual is expected to work onsite at WNYC‚Äôs Manhattan headquarters at least 2 days a week.

New York Public Radio is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We continuously strive to place our employees at the center of our thinking and elevate inclusive practices to develop and support a more engaged and productive workforce. Our journalism and operations in the service of that journalism benefit from a broad range of perspectives, from all backgrounds, at all levels of the organization. Diversity is essential to honest, authentic, accurate storytelling and reportage; creating an institution in which all voices are encouraged, valued, and heard.

Title: Data Analyst, Lifecycle Marketing
Description:
Curology provides incredibly personalized, effective, and affordable dermatology care at scale. We are a top player in custom skincare - we've helped millions of people feel more confident in their skin, offering custom acne or anti-aging prescription skincare delivered right to your door!

We're looking for a Data Analyst focused on Lifecycle Marketing to partner closely with our lifecycle team. This analyst will serve as the strategic analytical partner in driving customer engagement, improving retention, and maximizing lifetime value. The ideal candidate combines deep technical and analytical skills with a strong understanding of customer behavior, campaign performance, and lifecycle strategies.

Essential Duties & Impact Areas:


Act as the analyst embedded on the lifecycle team, deeply understanding customer journeys, campaign strategies, and lifecycle goals to deliver insights that influence roadmap, messaging, and investment decisions.
Define, maintain, and evolve core KPIs related to customer retention, engagement, churn, and lifetime value. Ensure consistent usage and understanding across stakeholders.
Own end-to-end dashboard development: gather requirements, design and iterate visualizations, and lead the launch of dashboards that inform lifecycle campaign performance, A/B testing results, and overall marketing impact.
Perform deep-dive analyses to uncover drivers behind customer behavior and campaign performance. Present findings clearly, including hypotheses, trends, and actionable recommendations.
Guide experimentation efforts across retention marketing by helping design A/B tests, tracking key metrics, and conducting rigorous post-test analysis. Translate results into data-backed decisions.
Develop and maintain statistical models and segmentation frameworks to support personalization, targeting, and lifecycle automation strategies.
Collaborate with data engineering and product partners to ensure accurate, scalable access to marketing data and assist in identifying data gaps, inconsistencies, or instrumentation needs.
Continuously seek optimization opportunities by surfacing growth levers or friction points, and championing data-driven ideas that improve retention, reduce churn, and maximize customer value.
Enable ongoing learning and communication through self-serve data tools, proactive reporting, and recurring insight share-outs to CRM, growth, and leadership stakeholders.
Identify opportunities to improve campaign performance and inform experimentation roadmaps for email, push, in-app, and SMS channels.
Address root causes of performance shifts and data variances using various analytical techniques and investigative approaches

Excellent Communication skills for client-facing interactions.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Opportunity for professional growth and skill development.

With support from the rest of the Analytics team

Driving us towards a self-serve first culture
Reporting on complex experimentation

Proficient in SQL with a proven track record of handling complex data queries and manipulation
